snippet: Researchers estimated that N.H.L. teams and their insurers paid about $653 million in salary to players sidelined by concussions and other injuries over three recent seasons.
abstract: Medical study by Dr Michael Cusimano, neurosurgeon at St Michael’s Hospital in Toronto, stresses financial reasons for National Hockey League to strengthen measures to prevent brain trauma in players; study appears in British medical journal Injury Prevention.
lead_paragraph: Researchers estimated that N.H.L. teams and their insurers paid about $653 million in salary to players sidelined by concussions and other injuries over three recent seasons.

headline.main: Citing Costs, N.H.L. Injury Study Urges More Safety
headline.print_headline: Citing Costs, Study Urges More Safety
